title: OZSpeech: One-step Zero-shot Speech Synthesis with Learned-Prior-Conditioned Flow Matching
author: Hieu-Nghia Huynh-Nguyen (FPT Software AI Center), Ngoc Son Nguyen (FPT Software AI Center), Huynh Nguyen Dang (FPT Software AI Center), Thieu Vo (FPT Software AI Center), Truong-Son Hy (University of Alabama at Birmingham), Van Nguyen (FPT Software AI Center), ...
relevance_why: The proposed model provides new methods in zero-shot speech synthesis, which directly relates to audio and speech capabilities that Haohe Liu explores in his research.
background: The task involves generating speech from text and an acoustic prompt, aiming to mimic an unseen speaker's voice using advanced machine learning techniques.
contribution: OZSpeech introduces a novel framework for zero-shot text-to-speech synthesis by utilizing optimal transport conditional flow matching for efficient one-step sampling, achieving significant improvements in content accuracy and model efficiency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with computational efficiency and required multiple sampling steps, leading to delays and higher resource consumption.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances TTS by enabling one-step sampling through a learned prior distribution, thus reducing noise sensitivity and maintaining high-performance metrics.

key_innovation: The model leverages an innovative learned prior distribution to streamline the synthesis process, drastically cutting down computation time while maintaining output quality.
real_world_impact: The model's efficiency and robustness against noise can significantly enhance applications such as virtual assistants and accessibility tools, improving user experience in critical scenarios.
limitations: The authors note that synthesized speech may exhibit slight distortions, impacting overall quality.

new_terms.optimal transport: **Optimal transport** is a mathematical theory related to comparing probability distributions, focusing on minimizing transportation costs between distributions.

open_sourcing: Code and audio samples are available at the demo page.
